executive_summary: Contract Research Organizations (CROs) have performed well during the current period, but revenue has been volatile. Revenue soared in 2020 as high demand for COVID-19 vaccines, treatments and drugs spurred investment in CROs. The industry has suffered in recent years, however, as higher interest rates have made it more expensive for pharmaceutical companies and other businesses to engage in research and development (R&D). High clinical trial costs and an uptick in patent expirations have driven pharmaceutical companies to outsource the management of clinical trials, boosting downstream demand for operators' services. Overall, revenue for CROs is anticipated to creep upward at a CAGR of 1.3% during the current period, reaching $20.8 billion in 2024 and including a 2.4% jump in revenue in that year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Medical Treatments Soared During the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the pandemic, state and local governments implemented lockdowns and social distancing measures to stop the spread of the pandemic. This hindered consumer spending and reduced corporate profit. Lower corporate profit gave businesses fewer funds for research and development (R&D), harming downstream demand for CROs' services. Despite this, contract research organizations greatly benefited from massive investments in new drugs and treatments because of the virus.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Shifting Practices Have Created Opportunities Despite Early Setbacks
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic also encouraged researchers to choose decentralized trials in which patients receive treatment at home outside the traditional hospital setting. These trials provide a lower cost and more efficient means for contract research organizations to conduct trials, though some variables may be more difficult to control. Decentralized trials are more labor-intensive, but this hasn't been a serious concern for CROs since employment has been increasing during the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Trial Costs and Patent Expirations Have Driven Investment in Research and Innovation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Clinical trial costs have steadily grown to a median of $41,117 per patient in 2020, according to Sofpromed. Contract research organizations (CROs) promise greater efficiency and lower costs, making them more attractive for companies willing to outsource trial management. Research investment has ticked up in response to drug patent expirations, motivating pharmaceutical companies to outsource research and fill revenue gaps.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Partnerships and Consolidation Have Been Increasingly Undertaken by Major Players
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: IQVIA, Charles River Labs, LabCorp, PAREXEL International, PRA Health Services, Pharmaceutical Product Development (PPD) and others have emerged as dominant forces in the contract research market. These companies have developed strategic partnerships with large pharmaceutical companies and health systems, representing a broader trend in the industry. According to Clinical Trials Arena, contract research organization mergers more than tripled from 2018 to 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Solid Economic Growth Will Spur Demand for Operators' Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to rising interest rates, recessionary fears and soaring inflation, US GDP is expected to expand during the outlook period. Steady economic growth will cause corporate profit to expand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising R&D Expenditure and GDP Will Drive Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As R&D expenditure rises, the number of clinical trials, post-surveillance studies and other studies will expand, raising revenue for contract research organizations. Rising GDP will also boost productivity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tight Financial Markets Will Hold Back Revenue Growth Somewhat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As inflation winds down, the Federal Reserve is expected to ease monetary policy slightly, causing interest rates to creep downward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Patent Expirations and the Aging Population Will Ensure Consistent Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While uncertain economic conditions will curtail large-scale demand for CROs' services, structural developments will provide a major avenue of growth for CROs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Decentralized Trial Adoption Could Shift Average Revenue Growth Much Higher
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Decentralized trial adoption has grown since the pandemic. The practice could significantly reduce costs for clinical trials and encourage patients to sign up.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) Will Accelerate Operator Efficiency
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With CROs continuing to face a slew of operational and labor costs and a diversified array of research trial opportunities, the adoption of artificial intelligence will be a significant accelerant for growth.

industry_definition: This industry includes companies that provide research services on a contract basis to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. Contract research organizations (CRO) offer biopharmaceutical development, preclinical research, clinical research and clinical trial management.

threats: Demand from brand name pharmaceutical manufacturing

key_trends: Mergers and acquisitions continue to be a staple of CROs, reinforcing the dominance of top companies.
Larger contract research organizations (CROs) compete for contracts and revenue, while smaller CROs compete for start-up biotechnology contracts.
Clinical trials have become more expensive amid high interest rates.
Acquisitions continue to contribute to a top-heavy competitive landscape.
Decentralized clinical trials will continue to gain popularity.
Publicly traded companies dominate the CRO market, holding nearly a third of market share.
Companies that invested in testing and vaccines research amid the pandemic saw substantial gains.
Most public assistance stems from federally funded programs.
Consistent oversight from organizations ensure CROs adhere to standards.
Clients are likely to make large investments if CROs can effectively cut costs.
CROs employ highly skilled scientists with significant educational requirements.
Key research hubs support pharmaceutical and biotech companies.
Telemedicine and decentralized clinical trials now offer at-home services.
Pharmaceutical companies facing patent expirations invest heavily to sustain profitability.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Pharmaceutical companies form the largest markets for contract research organizations (CROs), comprising more than two thirds of revenue.
Biotechnology companies apply biological and molecular techniques to develop products.
Other buyers of services from CROs include medical device manufacturers.

products_and_services.product_description: Clinical trials involve research using human participants to test new medical products.
Contract research organizations sometimes offer a slew of other services.

tier_1_suppliers: Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from Brand Name Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Brand-name pharmaceutical manufacturers constitute a significant market for contract research organizations (CROs).

business_locations.location_description: Pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies rely on California's prominent venture capital base.
Boston houses top-notch biotechnology companies and research hospitals.
The Mid-Atlantic's large population provides a solid base for running clinical trials.
Houston has experienced an influx of research organizations in recent years.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration holds Contract Research Organizations (CROs) accountable.
The FDA ensures drugs undergo extensive testing to confirm their safety and effectiveness.
Contract research organizations (CROs) are impacted by Good Clinical Practice regulations.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE HEALTH INSURANCE PORTABILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT (HIPAA) OF 1996
regulations_points.regulation_description: HIPAA limits the collection, storage, processing and sale of protected health information.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) ensures safe and healthy working conditions.

basis_points.basis_title: Mergers and acquisitions continue to be a staple of CROs
basis_points.basis_description: Mergers and acquisitions continue to be a staple of CROs, reinforcing the dominance of top companies.
Leading CROs are leveraging their resources to find efficient research methods.

basis_points.basis_title: Large CROs secure bulk of demand from major pharmaceutical clients
basis_points.basis_description: Large CROs secure the bulk of demand from major pharmaceutical clients.

concentration_points.concentration_title: CROs undergo acquisitions for research methods, clients and geography
concentration_points.concentration_description: Contract research organizations have high rates of mergers and acquisitions.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The big versus small divide creates two contrasting business strategies
concentration_points.concentration_description: Large contract research organizations establish development partnerships with pharmaceutical companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: CROs rely on skilled, knowledgeable employees, enhancing labor intensity.
Decentralized Trials Drive Clinical Research Growth.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Consulting Earns CROs Revenue From In-House Studies
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Contract research organizations consult with pharmaceutical companies.

volatility_points.volatility_title: RESEARCH INVESTMENT AND VC SUPPORT PUSH REVENUE GROWTH RATES UP
CLINICAL TRIAL VOLUME DETERMINES CRO SALES EVEN AS THE COST OF TRIALS FALLS

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Decentralized Trials Drive Clinical Research Growth
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Contract research organizations run clinical trials outside of the traditional hospital setting.

FAQs.question: Does your company rely heavily on demand from a single, key market?
FAQs.answer: Diversifying your company's client base reduces risk and expands the range of clients your company can attract in the future.

FAQs.question: How do you emphasize the value of your company's services?
FAQs.answer: demand for industry services by improving accessibility and connectivity with scientists.
